meanings.definition: To insert, as a scion of one tree or plant into another, for the purpose of propagation.
meanings.sent1: She carefully engrafted the young branch onto the older tree.
meanings.sent2: The gardener engrafted a new rose stem onto the existing bush.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel engrafted acorns into the ground, hoping for a forest of oak trees.
meanings.sent4: His ideas engrafted onto the team's project, bringing new life to the plan.
meanings.sent5: The teacher engrafted knowledge into the minds of her students like seeds in fertile soil.

meanings.definition: To insert or fix firmly into something else.
meanings.sent1: He engrafted the missing piece back into the puzzle.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith engrafted the handle onto the sword with precision.
meanings.sent3: The chef engrafted the secret ingredient into the recipe, making it irresistible.
meanings.sent4: Her words engrafted into his heart, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic engrafted the new part seamlessly into the engine, restoring its function.

meanings.sent1: The community engrafted their traditions into every celebration.
meanings.sent2: The architect engrafted the pillars into the foundation for added stability.
meanings.sent3: The superhero engrafted justice into every action, fighting for what is right.
meanings.sent4: His dedication engrafted respect from all who knew him.
meanings.sent5: The artist engrafted passion into every stroke of the brush, creating masterpieces.
